alert.note: Alert for Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast; Yukon Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 2:16PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: A series of low pressure systems will impact the West Coast with strong winds, heavy rain and coastal flooding beginning late Wednesday and continuing through Saturday. The first and weakest of these Bering Sea storms is a 975 mb low that will move into the Bering Sea to be located 150 nm southwest of St Lawrence Island low Thursday morning. This will bring a round of rain and gusty winds to the YK Delta and late Wednesday night and Thursday The rain and wind will push north into Norton Sound and the Seward Peninsula Thursday and Thursday night. This storm will bring elevated water levels in the 1 to 2 foot range above the normal high tide levels along south and west facing coastlines from Hooper Bay to the Bering Strait late Wednesday and through the day on Thursday. The second low is forecasted to be a very strong storm with the remnants of Tropical Storm Merbok that will move north and east out of the Northern Pacific Thursday into the Southern Bering Sea Thursday night and into the Central Bering Sea on Friday. This low will encounter favorable conditions aloft for deep and rapid cyclogenisis. Computer models continue to indicate rapid deepening of this low from around 965 mb early on Thursday to 950 mb to 945 mb on Friday. Weather models vary on the track of this feature, but are starting to converge on a track taking the low over the Central Bering Sea to be located as a 948 mb low 100 nm south of St Lawrence Island by Saturday morning. This track will bring very strong winds and heavy rain to coastal areas south of the Bering Strait beginning Friday afternoon and continuing into Saturday. The track of this low will greatly affect which areas will receive the worst impacts as far as coastal erosion and flooding along the coast. We will continue to closely monitor this storm. Those with interests on or near the West Coast should keep close tabs on this storm and be prepared to take protective actions. This storm has the potential to produce significant coastal flooding south of the Bering Strait.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast; Yukon Delta
